Module contents¶

ShapelyChipDesigns.MakeFingercapacitor(n1, n2, wfinger, lfinger, wgap, ltaper, wc, wGgap, wGfinger=None, lfingeradd=0, *kwargs)¶
Parameters:
  • n1 (int) – number of fingers (left side)
  • n2 (int) – “—————” (right side)
  • wfinger (int) – finger width
  • lfinger (int) – finger length
  • wgap (int) – finger-to-finger gap
  • ltaper (int) – taper length
  • wc (int) – transmission line - conductor width
  • wGgap (int) – transmission line: gap width
  • wGfinger (int) – _optional_ gap between the outer fingers and the groundplane
  • lfingeradd (int) – _optional_ an additional length can be added to the fingers which points into the gap
Returns:

A finger capacitor
Return type:

BRAND_NEW_STRUCTURE

Note

Without the optional argument wGfinger the gap between the outer fingers and the ground-plane holds the ratio of wc/wGgap

from pylab import show, figure
import ShapelyChipDesigns as SD
import mpld3

n1      = 3
n2      = 2
wfinger = 3
lfinger = 90
wgap    = 3
ltaper  = 100
wc      = 10
wGgap   = 4.5

CAP = SD.MakeFingercapacitor(n1, n2,
                             wfinger, lfinger, wgap, ltaper,
                             wc, wGgap)

fig = figure()
CAP.show_info()
SD.mouseshow()

mpld3.save_html(fig, "_img/test_finger_capacitor.html")

(Source code)

ShapelyChipDesigns.mybox((x00, y00), width, height)¶

Returns a rectangular polygon with the lower left edge at ‘x00, y00’ of width ‘width’ and height ‘height’.

ShapelyChipDesigns.empty()¶
ShapelyChipDesigns.smoothen(geom, r, n, show=False)¶

returns a smoothened version of the geometry. geom: polygon or linestring r: radius of curvature for the smoothing n: resolution of the smoothing (=number of points on the smoothing-circle)

class ShapelyChipDesigns.all_parts(glob)¶

all_parts can be used to join brandnew_structures at ankerpoints

join_parts(name1, name2, anker12)¶

the name2 part will be translated to the position of the name1 part. anker12 = [name of anker1, name of anker2]
